column4: SO here is my screen shot : http://i.imgur.com/sBH5Z.png -- On the right side it shows file manager. I want to merge the 2nd 4th and 5th partition which are empty
with gpartition -- shows on the left
how can I know which drive is known as sda2 and which one is sda7?
because all are called as new volume
hmm?
by their contents? size?  UUID?  You should give them labels, then they'll get mounted with their labels
sudo blkid
why do you want to copy a folder there?
its a C++ folder
be more specific
: its a c++ libraries folder that I want to copy to my college computer... because I cannot access internet there..
I tried that.. but Symatic just made a 10byte text file
yes then you run that script on a machine with internet
I didn't assume you did
I didn't do what?
go to a different machine with internet and run the script you generated.  It should download the packages you need.
man, I want to install c++ libraries on my college computer which does not have an internet access... thats it
you're not reading what I tell you
-__- u told me to download these packages on a different machine
yes, do that.  That's how you solve your problem.
I think this should work sudo cp * /home/Downloads usr/libraries
sure, if you want a broken system
will just pasting a file from my home computer to one in my college break it?
I told you what you need to do.  I do not understand why you continue to want to just copy files manually and avoid the package system.
